item.title: US Government Shutdown Ends As House Approves Funding Bill: Report
item.description: According to NBC, the House approved a funding package in a 217-214 vote on Tuesday, effectively ending the brief government shutdown.

item.title: Bitcoin Falls To Its Lowest Since Trump Took Office – Why Such A Selloff?
item.description: At the time of writing, Bitcoin fell 4.1% to $73,353, more than $1000 below and its lowest since Trump took office for a second term, just over a year...

item.title: This Stock Is Among The Laggards In Social Media Companies — Here’s What Wall Street Expects From Its Q4 Earnings Tomorrow
item.description: Snap shares have fallen nearly 45% over the past 12 months, only better than DJT, Sprout Social and Bumble over the same period.
